La señora Felicita tiene 48 años de edad, está casada con el señor Emilio quien es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes.
Cuenta que tiene una huerta hace mas de 11 años allí surte a sus vecinos y ocasionales clientes de lechuga, tomates, la señora Felicita es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya hace ya varios años y se caracterizó por ser muy responsable, su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Felicia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir plantando en su huerta. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Felicita is 48 years old.  She is married to Emilio, who is a farmer, and the couple have three adult children who live independently.

Felicita has had a vegetable garden for more than 11 years where she supplies her neighbors and occasional customers with lettuces and tomatoes.  Felicita has been a Fundación Paraguaya client for a number of years and has shown herself to be very responsible.  Her goal is to be able to continue working so that she can help her family.

Felicita is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other supplies so that she can continue planting in her vegetable garden.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rahat's Group

texts.en:
Rahat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her medical services business.

With the loan investment she will buy medicines and related tools that will help her to provide better quality services to her patients.

She is very experienced and has been operating her business for the past many years. Her patients trust her very well because she treats them with care.

She is confident that her business will further grow after investing the loan.

Note:  In the picture, the lady holding a book called "Asasah Passbook" is Rahat.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her medical services business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, 48, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelito, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), and a mother of four children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Celia operates a market stall. She sells vegetables and cooking products in the community market. She buys quantity of vegetables and cooking products and sells it per piece for a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables and cooking products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Celia dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of vegetables and cooking products needed in her business

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Mrs. Hien is 30 years old. She has two children who are going to school. 

She is a teacher and a carpenter. She earns 3,800,000 VND a month. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 50 years old. She has four children who are all adults. 

She has been a carpenter and has raised vegetables for a living for thirteen years. From her small business, she gains 4,600,000 VND a month. 

She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.ru:
Etot molodoy chelovek jenat i imeyet 2 detey. U nego bil sin i nedavno rodilas dochka. Rashad 31 god. On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya stroitelstvom i rabotayet masterom v domax. Rashad ranshe bil taxistom, no uje 3 qoda kak on bolshe ne rabotayet taxistom. On odin god praktioval i uchilsya u svoyego drugo masterstvu  i teper 2 qoda kak on sam rabotayet masterom v domax. Rashad nujdayetsya v 1800 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti. Rashad projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Rashad, on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu. 


http://partners.kiva.org/pa2/loan/67979
texts.en: This young man is married and has two children.  He has a son and a recently-born daughter.  Rashad is 31 years old.  He has been involved in construction for two years and works as a residential repairman.  Rashad previously worked as a taxi driver, but has not worked in that field for three years.  He spent a year practicing and studying his current trade from another repairman and has now been working on his own in homes for two years.  Rashad needs 1800 AZN to purchase necessary tools for his work.  Rashad lives in the Baku region with his wife and children.  This is his second loan, and he is very grateful to the lenders and Kiva for his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Einer Esau

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Einer Esau; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como guía de turismo, el trabaja viaja a diferentes lugares llevando turistas como machupicchu,por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es mejorar en su trabajo como guía de turismo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar carpas para su trabajo.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Einer Esau is a member of the Communal Bank "Yahuar Maqui", which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 25 years old and single. Einer divides his time between his daily activities and his work as a tour guide. He travels to different places, such as Machu Picchu, in order to give tours. Through his work, he is able to get ahead. Einer dreams of improving in his job as a tour guide. He is requesting a loan in order to buy tents for his job.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy tents.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Mrs Tam is 46 years old. She has two children whom are workers. She has worked as a carpenter for 12 years with an income of VND 4,000,000 each month. She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2010. Last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Ruquiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruquiya is the mother of five children. Her eldest son works while the remaining children stay at home. 

She is very talented and supports her family financially by doing decorative embroidery. She knows about the latest trend in fashion which helps her to fulfill client needs.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her embroidery business.

With the loan investment she will buy beads, thread, and embroidery frames. That will help her to improve her products and services and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for the past many years and is confident that the loan will help her to make even more money from her business.

loans.use: to buy beads, embroidery thread, and embroidery frames for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.ru: Elkhan zarabativaet na jizn selskoxozaystvennim biznesom vot uje 25 let. On derjit korovu i krupno rogatiy skot, prodayet moloshnie produkti i masyo. Ego jena i sin pomogayut emu vesti delo. Elkhan prostoy i trudolubiviy chelovek. On xochet sozdat bolshuyu fermu. On Obratilsa za dengami v 1200 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit stroymateriali dla remonta doma.
texts.en: Elkhan has been earning money in an agricultural business for 25 years.  He keeps cattle and sells milk products and meat.  His wife and son help him to run this business.  Elkhan is a simple and hardworking person.  He wants to create a large farm.  He requested a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN to buy construction materials and repair his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair his house

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es originario de San Lorenzo- Teustepe, casado, padre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad los cuales están casados, viven independientes. El inicio su actividad desde hace 20 años con ahorros propios, anteriormente viajo fuera del país a trabajar para buscar una mejor vida para su familia, luego de haber trabajado una temporada regresa al país a poner su propio negocio en el que ha ido invirtiendo con apoyo de instituciones financieras ya que al inicio su inventario era poco, no cubría la demanda de los clientes, cuenta con otros ingresos pues  también se dedica a la  crianza de pollos y cerdos de engorde. Su esposa lo apoya con la administración de la pulpería, su expectativa es seguir diversificándose en productos para su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos azúcar, arroz, aceite, frijol,  jabón, galletas, avena, etc. Todos los productos necesarios para surtir su inventario.
Este crédito será de ayuda porque podrá aumentar su inventario en la inversión de productos mas solicitados por los clientes lo que permitirá el incremento de sus ganancias, sus planes futuros es terminar de hacerle mejora  a su casa,  ampliar  el área del negocio y seguir con el desarrollo de la crianza de gallinas y cerdos, el espera seguir  contando con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su negocio activo y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from San Lorenzo-Teustepe.  He is married and has four childen, all grown now, married and living away from their father's house.  Eduardo operates a corner shop that he started with his own savings 20 years ago.  He worked outside the country for a year before so that he could raise the money he needed to make a better life for his family.  After working abroad, he returned to his country and started the store.  He had very little to begin with but, with help from financial institutions, he's built the business up over the years.  He had so few things to stock his store at the beginning that he had to earn an extra income raising and selling chickens and pigs.  His wife helps him operate the store now.  Eduardo wants to stock a wider range of products and he's applying for a loan that he will use to buy the merchandise he needs--sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, soap, snacks, etc.--to operate the business.
This investment will help Eduardo because he will be able to stock the merchandise that his customers most want and, in turn, increase his income.  For the future, he wants to improve his house, expand his business and support his animal sales business.  He hopes that he can continue to rely on Kiva lenders to operate his business and make a better life.

loans.use: to stock his corner shop.

loans.name: Thang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thang, 30 years old, has two children who attend school. She has worked as a carpenter for 7 years, earning a monthly income of 4,800,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In her last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, Mrs. Thang wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

Mrs. Lan, 36 years old, wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to do her carpentry work. 
Mrs Nhu, 39 years old, wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to do her carpentry work.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, 35, is married and has five children. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. 

For the past 2 years, Mariamu has operated a food stall business. She also generates additional income by selling fish. Mariamu has applied for a loan of 50,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, fish and cooking oil. Mariamu works seven days a week and sells to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Likoni to her shop. Mariamu hopes to to start a retail shop and to see her business expand to a wholesaler of fish.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульнора,женщина 43 лет.Замужем,имеет 4 детей.Более 12 лет занимается оптовой продажей риса.Рис закупает у колхозников и продает в отдаленные кишлаки района.Очень трудолюбивая,добросовестная женщина.Хорошо разбирается в сезонности бизнеса.Муж ее инвалид,в связи с этим она вынуждена работать в двойне,чтобы содержать семью в достатке.Гульнора 2007 года кредитуется в нашей организации и ни разу не нарушала политику кредитования.На полученный кредит она хочет закупить несколько мешков риса и расширить свой товарооборот.
texts.en: Gulnora is a 43 year-old woman, who is married and has four children.  She has been involved in wholesale sales of rice for over 12 years.  She buys rice from farmers and sells it at remote villages of the district.  She is a very hardworking and conscientious woman.  Gulnora is well-versed in business seasonality.  Her husband is disabled, and this is why she has to work twice as hard to provide well for the family.  Gulnora has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2007 and never violated our terms and conditions.  She wants to use this loan to purchase several bags of rice and increase her product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of rice

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo por quien lucha incansablemente para poder darle todo lo que necesita para una vida digna y sin privaciones ni necesidades.
La Sra. Elvia, tiene un taller de costura bien equipado, en su  casa de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso,  y nos cuenta que aparte del trabajo de costurera también es macatera.
Comenta que se inicio con un Copetín, y después cambio de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya formada por su antigüedad en el rubro de la costura.
Solicita el crédito para las compras de telas, hilos y otros insumos para poder seguir trabajando en la costura, ya que tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Elvia, 45, is married and has 1 son for whom she works tirelessly.  She wants to make sure that he never lacks for anything that he needs.

Elvia operates a tailoring business in his house in the Paraguayan city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She tells us that she is a street vendor, as well as a seamstress.  She started, she says, with a small restaurant and then switched to tailoring.  She is satisfied with her progress and says that her customers value the service she provides.

Elvia will use this loan to buy fabric, thread and the other supplies she needs to operate her business.  She has many orders that she would like to complete.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc. for her sewing business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Emma has a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Emma requested a loan of 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Emma has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough to improve her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a very active lady. She is young and energetic, and has given birth to 3 children. Sonia has not started providing education to her children yet. Her husband has a bicycle repair business and he also sells bicycle spare parts to his clients at reasonable rates. He has very good technical skills in his work and his clients trust him very much.

Sonia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities, which will help him provide better services to his clients and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Sonia is confident about his business success after investing this loan.

loans.use: To buy repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her business. She sells milk from home and also delivers it to customers. Pauline sells on credit and gets back her investment weekly, biweekly, or monthly depending on the agreement with each customer. She started working as a merchant seven years ago. Pauline wants to continually improve her business but her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her business turnover increases. Therefore she has sought out a Kiva loan through her third financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. Pauline will use the loan to buy buckets of milk to fill her customers' orders and make sure they have the best.

loans.use: to buy buckets of milk.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.ru: Vugar uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Posle okonchaniya shkoli on poyexal v armiyu a posle armii on ne smog postupit v universitet tak kak yemu nujno bilo zarabativat dengi i soderjat svoyu mamu kotoraya boleyet. Vugar ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. On chasto rabotayet taxistom daje po nocham chtobi zarabotat bolshe priboli. Vugar seychas nujdayetsya v 1800 AZN chtobi pochenit svoyu mashinu tak kak on ne mojet seychas rabotat izza togo chto ona isporilas. Vugar 28 let on jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Vugar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so sovyey mamoy, jenoy i rebonkom.
texts.en: Vugar has worked as a taxi driver for five years. After finishing high school he served in the army, and after his term was over family circumstances prevented Vugar from attending a university: his mother was sick and he had to work to take care and support her. He is now 28 years old, married and has one child. He lives in Baku together with his mother and his young family. Vugar is a very hard working man, and he often works as a taxi cab driver deep into the night so that he can earn more money. He currently needs a loan of 1800 AZN so that he can repair his taxi cab. Currently the cab is broken and Vugar hasn't been able to work as of late.

loans.use: to repair his taxi cab

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y el banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco  de la provincia del Cusco y del departamento de Cusco. La socia Marcelina sigue trabajando en la veterinaria como asistente. La socia Marcelina solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo ósea va comprar inyectables, alimento, vitaminas y otras cosas más. 

La socia Marcelina está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Marcelina, belongs to the Siempre Juntos community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She is still working as an assistant at a veterinary clinic.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her retail business with the merchandise she sells: injections, feed, vitamins, etc.

Marcelina is grateful for your help and committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Mayela Suyen

texts.es:
Doña Mayela junto a su esposo e hijos viven en el municipio de Ticuantepe, su esposo tiene un Tallercito de Refrigeracion y ella tiene un negocito donde vende Frutas y Verduras, entre los dos han sacado adelante a sus hijos y van contribuyendo a la mejora de su vivienda. con este  nuevo Financiamiento podran continuar con este sueño, Compraran materiales como: Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Zinc, Perlines, Bloques para poder levantar su casita.
Agradece mucho a Afodenic por confiar nuevamente en ella y por contribuir a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mayela lives with her husband and children in the town of Ticuantepe.  Her husband has a small refrigeration workshop and she has a small fruit and veg. business.  Between the two of them, they have provided for their children and contributed towards improving their home.  With this new loan, they will be able to continue pursuing this dream.  They will buy materials such as cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, beams and blocks in order to continue building their small house.

Mayela is very grateful to Afodenic for placing their trust in her once again and for helping to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies (blocks, cement and sand)

loans.name: Hydia

texts.en:
Hydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling herbal products in the Philippines.

Hydia requested a loan of 10,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her herbal medicines products. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Hydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her herbal medicine products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy wood for her furniture business. She has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wood for her furniture business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Leah requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. Leah has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhi is 28 years old. She has two children who are at primary school. 

She is a carpenter with an income of 3,800,000 VND each month. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio at home.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
Гульмире 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Муж Гульмиры трудится на шахте. Гульмира с 2000 года занимается продажей сельхозпродукции, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры -  товар она сама привозит с рынков г. Ош и с .Карасуу, что находится в 300 км, на сегодняшний  день в ее товарообороте находится примерно 80,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп товара для перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulmira is 35 years old, married and raising three children.  Her husband works at a mine.  Gulmira has been involved in selling agricultural crops since 2000, having started this business with an initial sum of 4,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulmira's hard work (she brings products from the markets of Osh and Karasuu, which is 300 kilometers away), today she has about 80,000 som (KGS) in her product turnover.  In order to further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy products for resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale

loans.name: Rigoberto Linder

texts.es:
El socio Rigoberto Linder sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y las reuniones son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio Rigoberto Linder sigue brindando servicio a la patria, él es policía y le va muy bien pues le gusta su profesión. El socio Rigoberto Linder trabaja desde muy temprano en la calles de la cuidad brindando seguridad a la población y poniendo el orden. 

En esta oportunidad el socio Rigoberto requiere el préstamo para uso personal desea para implementar su casa ósea va comprar algunos artefactos y para los gastos de la familia. El socio Rigoberto Linder está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Rigoberto Linder, is a long-time member of the Siempre Juntos community bank in the city of Cusco.

Rigoberto Linder has been a public servant for many years.  He is a policeman, work that he likes very much.  He starts early, keeping local streets safe, protecting the public and ensuring order.

Rigoberto Linder is applying for a loan that he will use to buy home appliances and pay other family expenses.  He says that he is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his family.

loans.name: Jerita

texts.en: Jerita lives in the Msambweni with her seven children. She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her children with the potential for success. Her children are the motivation behind her work of farming green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. It is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members, and friends. They are familiar with the products that Jerita prepares and are loyal to her business. Jerita's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase seedlings of vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. С ранних лет она пастила крупный рогатый скот и имеет  богатый опыт. Также она выращивает картошку. Полученный урожай она продает местным жителям на местном базаре. Она усердно работает, чтобы получить хорошую прибыль и сыграть свадьбу старшего сына. В бизнесе помогает её дружная семья. Гавхар хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота, чтобы откармливать и реализовать. Таким образом она хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить своего домохозяйство. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Gavhar is a hardworking and goal oriented woman. She is married and has three children. Since childhood Gavhar has raised cattle and has a lot of experience with animals. She also grows potatoes and sells the harvest at the local market.  Everyone in the family pitches in at the farm. Gavhar works diligently so that she can earn more money and be able to pay for her oldest son's wedding. Currently Gavhar needs to take out a loan to purchase cattle for fattening and resale. She hopes to be able to use the profits to expand her business and improve their home. Gavhar hopes for your help and charity.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Adil

texts.ru: Adil jivet v Baku regione vcmeste so svoyey semyoy. On uje 7 let kak imeyet magazin gde prodayot kuxanniye prinadlejnosti( kostruli,skovorodki, tarelki, noji, vilki,lojki, stakani i t.d)Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1900 AZN chtobi kupit noviye tovari dlya prodaji. Adil jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yemu 35 let. On lubit svoyu semyu i detey i radi nix starayetsya bolshe rabotat i uvelichit svoy mesachniy doxod. Adil xochet v budushem razvit svoy bizness i uvelichit svoy agazin dlya prodaji bolshe tovarov i raznix raznovidnostey.
texts.en: Adil lives in Baku together with his family. He is married and has two children. Adil is 35 years old and loves his wife and children. He is working very hard for their sake and wants to increase their monthly income. He has been managing a kitchen supply store for the past seven years. His store offers pots, pans, plates, knives, forks, spoon and glassware for sale. Currently Adil needs a loan of 1900 AZN for expanding the store's inventory. In the future Adil hopes to expand his store and be able to sell a large variety of different kinds of goods.

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Doña Rosario es originaria de San Lorenzo-Teustepe, casada, madre de 9 hijos mayores de edad, viven independientes, ella se dedica a la agricultura  específicamente a la siembra de arroz desde hace 5 años, anteriormente su actividad era la ganadería pero dejo de hacerla porque no le generaba muchos ingresos,  vio que el negocio de siembra de productos básicos era mas rentable, ahora sus productos los comercializa en la misma comunidad ya que cuenta con clientes fijos y para evitar gasto de transporte, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que la ayudan con la siembra de productos, su expectativa es seguir en su negocio y diversificarse en productos de calidad. Solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y preparación de las tierras con el objetivo de obtener un mejor rendimiento en la cosecha de este año, sus planes futuros es comprar  sus ganados para obtener otros ingresos, sus metas próximas es sembrar 2 manzana de arroz y con las ganancias que le genere la cosecha cancelar el préstamo, ella espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Kiva para cumplir su sueño de mantener su negocio  y poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Dona Rosario is from San Lorenzo-Teustepe.  She is married and has 9 grown children, all living away from their mother's house.  Dona Rosario is a farmer.  She has grown rice for 5 years.  She raised and sold animals before but her earnings were too meager to continue and she switched to rice farming when she saw that it was more profitable.  She sells to people in her community because she knows them and because her selling costs are less since she doesn't have to transport her crop to another town.  Her children help her on the farm.  Dona Rosario says that she wants to continue the business and focus on good-quality products.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to prepare her fields and buy the supplies she needs--fertilizers, manure, etc.--to ensure a good yield from her next crop.  For the future, she wants to buy cattle that she raise and sell for extra income.  Her immediate plan is to plant 2 tracts of rice and use the income to pay off this loan.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support because they have made it possible for her to build her business and make a better life.

loans.use: to prepare her field and buy supplies for her next crop.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia Cipriana sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y las reuniones son cada treinta en el distrito de Huanchac de la provincia de Cusco y del departamento de Cusco. La socia Cipriana se dedica a la venta de menudencia de cordero y sigue teniendo un local muy concurrido y conocido en la ciudad. En esta oportunidad Cipriana requiere el préstamo para la compra de menudencia de cordero como por ejemplo riñoncitos, hígado, viseras, corazón, huevos, patitas y cabeza de cordero. 

La socia Cipriana agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Cipriana still belongs to the communal bank Siempre Juntos and they meet every 30th of the month at the district of Huanchac of the province of Cusco of the department of Cusco.

She sells lamb offal and still has a busy and well-known shop in the city.

This time Cipriana wants to use her loan to buy lamb offal such as little kidneys, liver, guts, heart, testicles, little feet and head of lamb.

Cipriana appreciates the chance to get this loan that will allow her to invest in her business and grow her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy lamb offal.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
This is Ernesto, 32, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. His wife is Lennilyn, a housewife. Ernesto, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ernesto operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Ernesto hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо очень трудолюбивая женщина, она замужем. Имеет троих детей они все совершеннолетние. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелыми  и она с детства  работала на поле и откармливала скот. После того как вышла замуж продолжала заниматься животноводством и работала на земле, чтобы прокормить семью мужа. В основном она  выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. Уже более 30 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Муж и сыновья помогают ей в бизнесе. Полученный урожай она  продает местным жителям по более низкой цене чем на рынке. Мехринисо хочет получить побольше дохода и на полученный доход хочет улучшить своё благосостояние семьи. Мехринисо  хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота, чтобы откармливать и реализовать. Таким образом хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить доход для улучшения своего домохозяйство. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a very hard working woman. She is married and has three adult children. Mehriniso has always had a hard life. Since her childhood she raised cattle and worked in the fields. After she married she continued farming to feed and support her husband's family. She primarily grows wheat and oats and has been successful for the last 30 years in this business. Her husband and sons help at the farm. The family sells their harvest to the local residents below market prices. Mehriniso wants to get bigger profits from the farm and improve her family's living conditions. For this reason she wants to take out a loan for purchasing cattle which she will fatten and resell. Mehriniso is planning to expand her business this way and use the profits to improve their house. She hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 21 años, es una joven soltera. Vive con sus padres en el distrito agrícola de La Unión, Leticia.
Desde pequeña se dedica a la agricultura, empezó ayudando a sus padres, pero ahora ellos le otorgaron un terreno donde produce arvejas y habas, principalmente. Lleva como 2 años sembrando independientemente. Lo que cosecha lo ofrece en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad (a 40 minutos de su localidad). Sus compradores son a la vez vendedores, pero minoristas, por eso recibe una ganancia buena e inmediata. Isabel es una joven que no se conforma, pues con lo está ahorrando piensa estudiar una carrera técnica, pero menciona que no descuidará las labores del campo, porque es rentable.

Es la primera vez que Isabel accede a un crédito con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Ingresó a ser parte del banco comunal “Los ángeles de la unión 2”, y se siente muy emocionada de empezar con ese grupo.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar una bolsa de semilla de arvejas para iniciar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 21, is a single young woman. She lives with her parents in the farming district of La Unión, Leticia.

From the time she was a girl, Isabel has engaged in agriculture and began learning the trade with help from her parents. They have now given her a plot of land where she produces mostly peas and beans. She has been growing crops independently for two years. The products she harvests are offered at the wholesale market in the city (which is 40 minutes away from her town). Her buyers are also retail vendors, so she is able to receive a good level of immediate income. Isabel is a young woman who is not easily satisfied, so she is saving up money in hopes of studying for a technical degree. She says that she does not want to neglect her farm work since it is a profitable trade.

This is the first time that Isabel has accessed a loan from MFP. For this reason, she plans to be responsible with her payments by submitting them on time. She joined the Communal Bank "Los Ángeles de la Unión 2” and is excited about starting with this group. The money from this loan will be used to buy a bag of pea seeds so that she can start the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú  hace 2 años  y se dedica a la venta de ropa. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones por que allí se entretiene con sus compañeras y sobre todo porque le gustan mucho las capacitaciones ya que gracias a ellas aprendió a ahorrar su dinero, manejar su negocio adecuadamente, a mejorar el trato con su familia y con sus clientes. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños para su negocio.
texts.en: Norma is a member of Bancomunal Sonrisa. She is 49 years old and the mother of one son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for two years, and she works selling clothing. She likes to attend the meetings because she has a good time with her colleagues and above all because she really likes the training. Thanks to that training, she has learned how to save her money, run her business correctly, and improve her dealings with her family and her customers. She will invest the requested loan by purchasing women's, men's, and children's clothing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's, men's, and children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia  es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años y es comerciante, vende cereales al por mayor y menor que  también vende en las ferias. Está orgullosa de pertenecer a FINCA Perú donde aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones que recibe en las reuniones de su Bancomunal, gracias a eso aprendió a llevar bien su negocio y a educar bien a su hijo, también aprendió a distribuir su dinero de manera productiva. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para llevar a las ferias y poder venderlos.
texts.en: Lucia is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is 44 years old and a mother of four. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for six years and she is a merchant. She sells wholesale and retail grains, which she also sells in the markets. She is proud of belonging to FINCA Perú, where she learned a lot through the trainings offered at her communal bank meetings. Thanks to them she learned good business management and parenting skills. She also learned how to distribute her money productively. She will invest the loan she is now requesting in the purchase of grains, which she will take to the markets and sell.

loans.use: to purchase grains, which she will take to the markets and sell.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee es socia del Bancomunal Dignidad, tiene 48 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de Finca Perú hace más de 3 años y es dueña de una bodega donde vende abarrotes. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones donde aprendió del compañerismo, le brindan mucho apoyo y eso es muy importante para ella, pero sobre todo le enseñan a cerca del desarrollo personal, en su negocio y en su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Aydee is a member of the 'Dignidad' community bank.  She is 48 years old and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than three years and owns a store where she sells groceries.  She enjoys attending meetings where she has learned about team spirit.  She receives a lot of support and this is very important to her.  Above all, she learns about personal development, both in her business and family environment.   Aydee will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries such as milk, sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as milk, sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 37, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Millirocen, an overseas Filipino worker, and mother of three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Jocelyn operates a silkscreen printing business. Silkscreen printing is the process of creating a stencil in a mesh screen and then using a squeegee to push the ink through the mesh onto a shirt or garment. Clients go to her to request for printing; they give their desired pattern or design. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 per week.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like paint, a screen, and shirts. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jocelyn dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is a married woman with seven adult children. Her husband is a farmer. Carmencita supports her family by raising pigs to sell. She also helps her husband grow rice on their land. She has requested a loan to purchase pig feeds and fertilizers. Carmencita hopes to have a successful piggery business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she lives with her family. A married mother of seven, Cecilia earns 10000 PHP per month selling rice, snack foods, toiletries and various other items. She works hard to help improve her family's living conditions. Now requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods, Cecilia hopes to increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia es socia del Bancomunal El Roble, tiene 43 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 9 años y es dueña de una tienda donde vende abarrotes y también tiene un restaurante. Ella dice que gracias a FINCA Perú pudo mejorar económicamente así como personalmente, le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal por que le ayudaron mucho y aprendió a distribuir sus ganancias. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su tienda y de alimentos  para preparar las comidas de su restaurante.
texts.en: Eulogia is a member of the communal bank El Roble. She is 43 years old and a mother of two. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for over nine years. She owns a store where she sells groceries and also has a restaurant. She says that thanks to FINCA Perú she was able to improve herself both financially and personally. She really enjoys the trainings offered by her communal bank, because they have helped her a lot and she has learned how to distribute her profits. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of groceries for her store and ingredients to prepare her restaurant food.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store and ingredients to prepare her restaurant food.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: A 57-year-old married mother of seven, Trinidad has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years now. The recipient of five previous loans from NWTF, Trinidad is requesting a new one for PHP 14,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas es de la ciudad de Pilar. El Sr. se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, productos agrícolas y demás tipos de productos. Está casado, tiene hijos, todos ya mayores, su señora se dedica a la tamberia donde provee de leche a los del barrio.
Nicolas es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desea poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de productos agrícolas, con los cuales podrá surtir su negocio y seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad al que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
Nicolas is from the city of Pilar. He works buying and selling livestock, agricultural products and other types of products. He is married with children, all of them adults. His wife works at a dairy farm that provides milk to the neighborhood.

Nicolas is a hardworking entrepreneur who wants to be able to continue working and helping his family. He wants to continue growing and in this way continue helping his family.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy agricultural products, with which he will be able to supply his business and continue giving his customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina es socia del Bancomunal El Roble, tiene 32 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y es dueña de un restaurante.  Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a administrar bien su dinero y también a ahorrar, mejoró en el campo laboral. También le gustan mucho las campañas de salud que ofrece FINCA Perú, ya que eso le permite saber a cerca de su salud y que puede hacer para mejorarla. Ella dice que ahora ella tiene los conocimientos para saber decidir y proceder en su negocio y  en su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la preparación de las comidas que vende en su restaurante.
texts.en: Alejandrina is a member of the 'El Roble' community bank.  She is 32 years old and the mother of two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and owns a restaurant.  She really enjoys the training sessions that she attends as a member of her community bank.  During her time as a FINCA Peru member, she has learned how to manage her money well and also how to save.  She has made improvements in her business life.  She also really likes the health campaigns that FINCA Peru offer as they enable her to learn more about her health and what she can do to improve it.  She says that she now has the knowledge she needs to make decisions and progress in her business as well as in her family life.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries for preparing the meals that she sells in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy groceries for preparing the meals that she serves in her restaurant

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
Andres es originario de San Lorenzo-Teustepe, casado, de oficio agricultor  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, padre de 4 hijos. Andres inicio su actividad ayudándole a su papa en la ganadería mientras su mama vivía de los ingresos que le generaba el alquiler de las tierras, luego sus padres le heredan a Andres partes de las tierras, el que ya había obtenido experiencia y dominio en el negocio, decide independizarse, empieza sembrando por su propia cuenta 2 manzana de arroz para aprovechar las tierras, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus primos, hijos y esposa que le ayudan en la preparación de las tierras ahora lleva tres años en su negocio, sus productos los comercializa en la misma zona para evitar gastos de transporte y porque es mas seguro vender los  productos en su comunidad, también cuenta con otros ingresos  provenientes de la venta de leche que producen sus vacas  para poder ayudarse con los gastos del hogar.
Realiza el préstamo para preparación de las tierras, comprar abono, insumos y veneno para las plagas, el cual estima será de ayuda porque podrá obtener mejor producción que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, sus planes futuros es comprar  mas ganado de reproducción para poder vender ganado de raza y mantener su producción de leche, su meta próxima es sembrar 2 manzana de arroz y con las ganancias cancelar el préstamo ya que sus objetivo es  salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is originally from San Lorenzo-Teustepe.  He is married and the father of four children.  He is a farmer by profession and grows rice.  Andres started out helping his dad with raising his livestock while his mom lived off the income she made renting out their land.  His parents gave Andres some of their land as an inheritance.  Having gained experience and skill in the business, he decided to start working for himself.  He started sowing crops on his own.  He has two 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of land sown with rice.  He has the support of his cousins, children and wife in his business.  They help him to prepare his land.  He has been in this business for three years now.  He sells his crops in the local area to avoid having to pay for transportation and because it is safer to sell the produce in his own community.  He also receives additional income from selling milk from his cows.  This enables him to help with the household expenses.

Andres is taking out this loan to prepare his land and to buy fertilizers, supplies and pesticides.  He believes that this will be helpful because he will be able to enjoy a better production which will allow him to increase his income.  His future plan is to buy more cattle to breed so that he can sell thoroughbred cattle and maintain his milk production.  His most immediate aim is to sow 2 'manzanas' with rice and use the profits to repay his loan.  His goal is to get ahead in life together with his family.

loans.use: to prepare his land and to buy fertilizers, supplies and pesticides

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is 30 years old and a resident from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married and has two young children who still need her support and daily allowances.

She is a farmer, cultivating rice for sale each harvest season. At the same time, Rin is also in the business of selling used clothes in the village for additional income, earning around 2.00 USD per day.

To increase clothes to sell in her store, she would like to take out a loan of 600.00 USD to purchase used clothes. This can satisfy her customers and also add more customers to her business. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to upgrade her living standard and uplift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma, es una joven  de 24 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos  y vive en la Ciudad de Puerto Cortes.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica al negocio de venta de productos HERBALIFE (productos medicinales) Ella comenzó consumiendo este producto HERBALIFE y ahora los distribuye con el objetivo también de compartir una mejor salud con más personas. Sus ingresos son complementados por la ayuda de su esposo. 
El financiamiento que ODEF le ha dado de 10,000 lempiras  es para comprar y surtir de productos HERBALIFE para cumplir con los pedidos. 
Con las ganancias ella espera extenderse y  mejorar su calidad de vida y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emma is a 24 year old young woman.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in the city of Puerto Cortes.

For two years she has been devoting herself to the business of selling Herbalife products (medicinal products).  She started consuming Herbalife products, and now she distributes them.  Her objective is to also share better health with more people.  Her income is complemented by help from her husband.

The loan from ODEF for 10,000 lempiras is to buy and stock Herbalife products in order to fill orders.

With the income she hopes to expand and to improve her quality of life.  She also hopes to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife (natural medicine) products to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Bancomunal Sonrisa, tiene 35 años de edad y 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 6 años y es dueña de una tienda donde se dedica a la venta de joyas. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal como el manejo de su negocio y de su familia, ella dice que sin la ayuda de las capacitaciones no tendría tan buena relación en su familia y su negocio no marcharía bien como ahora, se siente muy orgullosa de sus hijos porque son buenos hijos con todo lo que ella le ha inculcado. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de joyas, platería y otros productos de bisutería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is 35 years old with 2 children. 

She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 6 years and is the owner of a store where she sells jewelry. During the time that she has been a member of FINCA Perú she has learned a lot from the training she received from the communal bank such as managing her business and her family, and she says that without the help of the training she could not have provided for her family and her business would not have come along as well as now. 

She feels very proud of her children because they are good children amidst everything she has taught them. 

The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of jewelry, including sliver, and other costume jewelry for her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, including silver, and other costume jewelry for her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y este banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Huanchac de la provincia de Cusco y del departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma se sigue dedicando a la elaboración de hamburguesas, sándwich, jugos y también vende todo tipo de productos de snack, gaseosas, dulces, galletas y entre otros, ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad la socia Vilma solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería, dulces, empanadas, gelatinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates e insumos para la elaboración de los diversos sándwiches como por ejemplo pollo, carne, pan, salsas y otras cosas más. 

La socia Vilma agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Member Vilma still belongs to the communal bank Siempre Juntos. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, within the province of Cusco and the departament of Cusco.

Member Vilma is still working making hamburgers, sandwiches, fruit juices, and also sells all kinds of snack products, such as soft drinks, sweets, cookies, and others. She has a stall set up at one of the schools in the city of Cusco. 

This time, Vilma is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of merchandise, sweets, empanadas, gelatins, soft drinks, cookies, chocolates, and ingredients to prepare a variety of sandwiches, such as chicken, meat, bread, sauces, and other things.

Member Vilma is grateful for the opportunity of this loan, which will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru:
Атыркул 60 лет, замужем. Атыркул с 2002 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Атыркул -  на сегодняшний  день в ее хозяйстве находится 2 коровы, 15 овец, 8 лошадей и 2 козы, что приносит примерно 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и закуп стройматериалов на реконструкцию дома.
texts.en:
Atyrkul is 60 years old, she is married. Atyrkul has been involved in animal husbandry since 2002, a business she started with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Through hard work Atyrkul's business now has two cows, fifteen sheep, eight horses and two goats which generates about 7,000 KGS per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.

In order to further develop her business Atyrkul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som to purchase young livestock. Atyrkul plans to invest the income from loan in a further increase of the livestock and to purchase materials for the reconstruction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Daisy Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Daisy tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una aldea suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a sus 3 hijos de 4, 10 y 18 años de edad. Ya tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. A este negocio le dedica todo el día y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre quien le ayuda a elaborar tortillas. Este producto tiene gran demanda en la comunidad, vende bastantes y logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Actualmente está solicitando el quinto préstamo para seguir invirtiendo y creciendo con su negocio, del cual va comprar los insumos como harina de maíz y leña para elaborar las tortillas. Su meta sigue siendo la de sacar a su familia adelante y darles el estudio a sus hijos. Esta agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Daisy is 43 years old and single mother. She lives in the suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her three children ages 4, 10, and 18.

Daisy has been making and selling corn tortillas for over 10 years.  She devotes the whole day to this business.  Her mother helps her make the tortillas.  There is a great demand for this product in the community.  She sells quite a few, and she manages to get the income needed to support her family.

She is currently requesting her fifth loan in order to continue investing and growing with her business.  She will use the loan to buy supplies like corn flour and firewood for making the tortillas.

Her goal is to continue getting her family ahead and to give her children an education.  She is grateful for the financial support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and firewood for making tortillas.

loans.name: Las Hermosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Hermosas y está conformado por ocho mujeres indígenas originarias de un pueblo llamado San Sebastián Ixcapa, una pequeña comunidad rica en gastronomía.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Lorenza Patricia, mejor conocida como Doña Paty, de cuarenta y ocho años de edad. Paty se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan así como de otros platillos mexicanos. Normalmente, ofrece sus alimentos en un jardín de niños ubicado en su comunidad, donde lleva vendiendo treinta años.

Doña Paty es madre soltera y comenta que gracias a las buenas ganancias que obtiene gracias a su negocio, pudo darles una buena educación a sus cinco hijos, todos ellos ya están casados. Menciona que una de las características  que debe tener una persona para realizar el trabajo que ella hace es tener mucha higiene, una buena sazón y sobre todo ser una persona activa. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio de la venta y elaboración de pan es el aroma del pan recién sacado del horno, aparte de que también es el que más vende. Por otro lado, lo que representa mayor reto para Paty es el momento en que tiene que matar el pollo para elaborar la tinga para sus tostadas, ya que no le gusta hacerles daño a los animales. Doña Paty dice que una de las experiencias más lindas que ha tenido respecto a su negocio es que a prendido a ser una mujer independiente ya que le gusta trabajar su dinero y sus  ganancias. Dice también, que se considera una mujer especial porque aunque ha tenido  necesidades como madre soltera, nunca le faltan fuerzas para lograr lo que se propone. Paty pidió su crédito para comprar harina, huevo, manteca, levadura, royal, mantequilla y leche para la elaboración de pan.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Elva - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Cecilia - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Martina - se dedica a la venta de antojitos  mexicanos.
Susana - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Elsa - se dedica a la venta de a se dedica a la venta de comida.
Rosalina Alberta - se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Silvia - se dedica a la venta de pan.

Le dan las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudar todas las madres que nunca se rinden y que desean tener los ingresos para triunfar.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Hermosas and is made up of eight indigenous women from the town of San Sebastián Ixcapa, a small community rich in gastronomy.  One of the members of this group is Lorenza Patricia, 48, better known as Doña Paty.  Paty makes and sells bread and other Mexican dishes.  Normally she sells her food in a kindergarten located in her community, where she has been selling for 30 years.

Paty is a single mother.  She comments that, thanks to the good profits she gets from her business, she managed to give her five children a good education.  All of them are already married.  She mentions that one of the characteristics for doing the work she does is to be very hygienic, to have  good seasoning, and above all to be an active person.

What she most likes about her business making and selling bread is the aroma of the bread when it comes out of the oven.  Besides, it is her biggest seller.  On the other hand, Paty's biggest challenge is when she has to kill the chicken to make the shredded chicken for her tostadas, because she doesn't like to hurt animals.

Paty says that one of her most beautiful experiences in her business is that she has learned to be an independent woman, because she likes to work with her money and her profits.  She also says that she believes she is special because, although she has had needs as a single mother, she always has the strength to achieve what she sets out to do.

Paty requested her loan to buy flour, eggs, lard, yeast, Royal brand baking powder, butter, and milk to make bread.

The other members of the group are Elva, Cecilia, Martina, and Susana, who all sell Mexican snacks; Elsa, who sells food; Rosalina Alberta, who sells beverages; and Silvia, who sells bread.  They thank Vision Fund for helping all the mothers who never give up and who want to have the income to be successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Tatiana Yiselth

texts.es: La señora Tatiana habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, ella labora como enfermera en una Clinica Privada de donde debenga un salario mensual, ademas ella a cultivado Piña, y obtiene a traves de estos cultivos mas ingresos economicos para mejorar de vida, en estos momentos Tatiana establecera una manzana  mas de Piña y  con este financiamiento lo lograra ya que compra insumos necesarios para este cultivo, Urea, los hijos de piña que sembrara, fertilizante, completo. muy contenta nos expresa que esta muy agradecida con Afodenic quien atraves de Fondos Kiva ayudan a personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Tatiana lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She works as a nurse in a private clinic where she earns a monthly salary. 

She also grows pineapples and obtains through these crops more income to improve her life. 

At this time Tatiana will plant a plot of pineapples. With the loan she will buy necessary supplies for the crop, urea, the pineapple seeds, fertilizer, everything. She is very happy and tells us that she is very grateful to Afodenic for arranging funds through Kiva that help people with few resources.

loans.use: to plant a plot of pineapples

loans.name: Alejo Armando

texts.es:
El señor Alejo Armando, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, tiene una hija y vive en Puerto Cortes.
Hace 8 años que Alejo Armando, se dedica a elaborar y vender HOT DOG (pan relleno con un hot dog , repollo y salsa caliente), de esta forma se gana la vida y ayuda a su familia. Este bocadillo lo vende de manera ambulante manejando una carretilla de bicicleta. El está solicitando un préstamo por 6,000.00 Lempiras para hacerle reparaciones a la carretilla y para comprar los insumos para la preparación del producto como ser: pan especial para HOT DOG, salsas,  HOT DOG, repollo y otros. El espera mejorar la apariencia de su carretilla y vender más. Su meta es llegar a tener varias carretillas y contratar personas que le ayuden a vender más producto para incrementar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Alejo Armando, 38, is single and has a daughter; he lives in Puerto Cortes.  He’s been making and selling hotdogs (bread stuffed with a hotdog, cabbage and hot sauce) for 8 years.  He earns a living and supports his family this way.  He sells this snack from place to place driving a bicycle powered cart.

He’s asking for a 6000 lempira loan to repair the cart and to buy ingredients to make his product such as special hotdog buns, sauces, hotdogs, cabbage and others.  He hopes to improve his cart’s appearance and to sell more.  His goal is to have several carts and to hire people to help him sell more product to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy hotdog making supplies and to repair his food cart.

loans.name: Grupo Galaxia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Galaxia esta constituido por siete emprendedoras vecinas del municipio de Apodaca. Ellas decidieron reunirse para adquirir un compromiso de crédito de manera grupal pues mutuamente se motivan para salir adelante.
Imelda es una de sus integrantes. Hace tiempo estuvo casada, pero su unión concluyo. Cuando sucedió lo anterior, ella ya se encontraba fuera del mercado laboral, esto la impulso a establecer un negocio propio para poder ser independiente y autónoma. 
De poco a poco, fue delineando su negocio de decoración y novedades para el hogar y ella hoy se compromete nuevamente con un crédito para invertir en su negocio para tener mejores productos  y mayor variedad.
Esta segura que esta acción le permitirá mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
The group Galaxia comprises seven entrepreneurs residing in the town of Apodaca. These women decided to get together so that they could receive a group loan, because they motivate each other to get ahead.
Imelda is one of its members. She was married some time ago, but that relationship ended. When that happened, she was no longer in the job market, so this prompted her to set up her own business, in order to become self-employed and independent. 
Little by little, she gradually formulated her home decor and novelties business, and today she is committed again to investing a loan in her business, so that she may have better products and more variety.
She is confident that this action will allow her to improve and grow.

loans.use: to invest in business merchandise (notions and home decor products).

loans.name: Lesby Patricia

texts.es:
Lesby Patricia tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad, vive en colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Lesby es una persona muy emprendedora ella anteriormente trabajaba en un salón de belleza donde aprendió muy bien esta actividad y hace dos años y medio decidió establecer su propia sala de belleza donde ofrece los servicios de corte de pelo, secado, alisado, manicure, pedicura y otros. También está terminando de establecer un negocio de cibercafe lo que le generará otros ingresos. Con el préstamo que solicita de 25,000.00 Lempiras ella  va comprar otras computadoras  con sus  muebles  para ampliar el negocio de cibercafe y otra parte la va invertir en la sala de belleza en la compra de productos de belleza.  Este préstamo es el tercero y le han ayudado a incrementar los ingresos y a tener una estabilidad económica. Su meta es crecer y colocar una franquicia ya que el internet  es un negocio rentable. Agradece mucho a ODEF y a Kiva por la oportunidad de crecimiento que le están dando.
texts.en:
Lesby Patricia, 29, is a single mother; she has two children who are 5 and 10 years old.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.

Lesby’s a very enterprising person.  She used to work in a beauty salon where she learned this activity very well and two and a half years ago decided to open her own beauty salon where she offers haircuts, drying, straightening, manicure, pedicure and others.  She’s also finishing installing an Internet café business that will generate additional income.

She will use the 25000 lempira loan she’s requesting to buy more computers with their respective furniture to expand the Internet café business and another part of it will be invested in the beauty salon with the purchase of beauty products.

This loan is the third one and they have helped her increase income and have economic stability.  Her goal is to grow and establish a franchise because Internet is a profitable business.  She is very grateful to ODEF and to Kiva for the growth opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon and computers and furniture for her Internet café.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia tiene 33 años, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ella es comerciante, tiene una Despensa en la cual trabaja desde hace 4 años de experiencia.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que siempre se esfuerza al máximo por poder ayudar a sus familiares y darles todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para abastecer su local con bebidas, enlatados, panificados, y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir teniendo bien abastecido su negocio. Agradece por la ayuda que fundación paraguaya y Kiva le dan.
texts.en:
Lidia, 33, is from the city of Curuguaty.  She’s a merchant; she has a store she has four years’ experience working with.  She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum degree to be able to help her family members and to give them everything they need to have a life with no privations or unmet needs.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods and others to continue having it well-stocked.  
She is grateful for the support Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Julieta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fruit selling business for 9 years in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy assorted fruits to sell. 

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda, 31 years old, is the mother of one child. She sells different items in her store. Veneranda wants to use this loan to add more new items such as sugar, beans, and rice to sell. She will use the profits from the business for savings. Veneranda is very thankful for the previous loan which she believes helped her so much.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and beans to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilou has  requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она предоставляет услугу такси по городу. В этой области Барно шесть лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Barno is a resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. Barno works as a taxi driver in the city. She has worked in this area for six years. Barno is taking out this loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она шесть лет как занимается торговлей детской и женской одежды у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения детской вечерней одежды.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in Khujand. She is 36 years old, divorced and has two children. She has been selling children's and women's clothes from her home for six years. Gulbahor is taking out this loan to purchase party clothes for children.

loans.use: to purchase children clothing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 37 años de edad es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. 

El socio Carlos es técnico dental y tiene un pequeño laboratorio dental donde hace piezas dentales y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo yeso, acrílicos, alambres y otras cosas más. 

El socio Carlos agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the city of Pilcopata in Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He’s 37-years-old, married and this beautiful relationship has produced two children.

Carlos is a dental technician; he has a small dental lab where he makes dental products.  On this occasion he needs the loan to buy work materials like plaster, acrylics, wire and other things.

Carlos is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba tiene 44 años de edad, se describe como una persona responsable y muy trabajadora por el bienestar de su familia. Rosalba vive con su esposo y su hijo en la ciudad de Tulcán que se encuentra en la Provincia del Carchi.

Rosalba trabaja sola en la compra venta de verduras y frutas, negocio que le permite sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente solicita un préstamo a Fodemi con el fin de invertir en estanterías para sus frutas y verduras que le ayudarán a que su negocio sea mas presentable y también va a invertir en la compra de naranjas, mandarinas y verduras que en esta época la venta sube considerablemente y sus ingresos mejorarían logrando cambiar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Rosalba sueña en tener un local grande para poder ofrecer mayor diversidad de frutas y verduras y otros víveres.
texts.en:
Rosalba, 44, describes herself as a responsible, very hardworking person for her family’s wellbeing.  Rosalba lives with her husband and son in the city of Tulcán located in Carchi Province.

Rosalba works alone buying and selling vegetables and fruit, a business that allows her to cover household expenses.  She is currently asking Fodemi for a loan to invest in shelving for the fruit and vegetables that will help her business be more presentable and she will also invest in the purchase of oranges, mandarins and vegetables which in this season go up considerably and her income improves thus attaining a change in her family’s quality of life.

Rosalba dreams with having a large locale to be able to offer a greater diversity of fruit and vegetables and other foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy fruit and shelving.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
